PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mrs. Juanita Harris, 6544 Frankstown Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 21, 1958, pg.5 with question: "Do you think that the city needs a fair housing ordinance?"  Answer reads:�I think that it needs one. Everyone should have the right to live wherever he or she chooses and there should not be any discrimination at all."�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Juanita Harris holding lapel of light colored coat and standing in front of the Buhl Building, with passersby and George Barbour in background, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
